intro: Erysimum consimile, commonly known as the common wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lobed or heart-shaped. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, bloom in early spring and are often found in rocky or disturbed soils. Erysimum consimile is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
